speaker: Opening
text: Christmas lights strung on the Space Needle  * * *  ## Transcript {Erin Evans}    [_Act 1_]  [_Scene 1 - Caf e Nervosa Fade in.� Frasier enters and sees Roz seated at a table next to the counter.� There is a waiter at the table with reindeer antlers on his head._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, hey Roz.� Can I join you?���

speaker: Roz
text: � Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: � [_to waiter_] Ah... May I have a latte to go, please?� And I... I hope that they're paying you extra to wear that.  [_He takes the seat across from Roz._]  Waiter:� No, but I was hoping that it would help me with my tips.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Ah.� Well, as you know my tipping policy stands firmly on the twin pillars of courtesy and efficiency.� But today I shall include - [_tips him_] -- whimsy.� Merry Christmas. Waiter:� God Bless You, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Well... [_The Waiter leaves._]���

speaker: Roz
text: � I'm really surprised Frasier, I didn't think you'd go for something kitschy like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: � It's Christmas time I say let a thousand antlers bloom.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh, well what a relief.  [_She takes off her coat to reveal an elf costume._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh... oh, Roz.���

speaker: Roz
text: � I'm working Santa's Toy Drive at the mall.� I'm an elf.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Roz, if you needed extra cash you should have come to me.� I've got plenty of odd chores around the house.���

speaker: Roz
text: [_looks disgusted_] It's not about money.� I'm volunteering.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh!� Well, good for you, yes.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Yeah, visiting Santa Claus at the department store was one of my favorite memories as a kid.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Mmmm... I always found him terrifying - and inquisitorial.���

speaker: Roz
text: � When I was seven - my mom and dad took me to the mall to see Santa...

speaker: Frasier
text: � Uh-huh.���

speaker: Roz
text: � [_continuing_] They were going through their divorce at the time so they were barely talking.� Anyway, when I sat down on his lap -- I started to cry and he was just so nice, he made me feel safe and�protected... I don't know, he just made me feel special.� So if I can do that for just one little kid - you know?� I'd like to do that. [_She nods_]

speaker: Frasier
text: � I'm sorry I laughed at you, Roz.� You should be very proud of yourself.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Thank you, and I better go before I'm late.  [_She gets up from her chair_]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, right.� You know what, I'm going too, I'll walk with you.  [_He gets up from his chair as Roz picks up her coat from the back of her chair.� As she passes Frasier, who is now at the counter, the bells on her costume jingle.� He turns to see her at the door putting an elf hat on her head._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Actually Roz, [_She looks up_] why don't you go ahead?� I'm going to get myself a scone.  [_Roz leaves and Frasier turns back towards the counter as we fade out._]  [_Commercial Break_]  [_Scene 2:�Frasier's apartment.� Frasier answers the door to Niles and Daphne.� Martin is in his chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � Hello!�

speaker: Niles
text: � Hello, Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, hi guys.� Good to see you.  [_As they enter Frasier kisses Daphne on the cheek.� Daphne goes into the living room, while Niles starts talking to Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Come on in.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Hey!� Ah, we were hoping to uh, use your wassail bowl.  [_Frasier closes the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, I'm sorry.� I've already loaned it to Lawrence Emerson and his mandrel-caroling group.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Well you can kiss that bowl good-bye.� Frasier, the Yule Tones are the bad boys of Renaissance Christmas music.� Have you ever seen a church common room after one of their performances?

speaker: Martin
text: Why don't you just use the punch bowl?

speaker: Frasier
text: � Because then it wouldn't be wassail, it would be punch.

speaker: Martin
text: What's the difference?  [_Niles makes noise in the background._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � Me dad used to say that punch would make you want to kiss the donkey in the manger scene and wassail makes you want to check into the inn.

speaker: Frasier
text: � That's very funny. [_walks over toward her_] Uh, listen Daphne, uh, I was just wondering, is your mum partial to a traditional Cornwell dressing?� You see, I'm thinking it'd go splendidly with the 12-lb. Hungarian goose that I'm serving.  [_Martin gets up from his chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � [_laughs and walks over to Niles_] Mum is spending Christmas on a cruise, an early Christmas present from Niles.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Yes, I didn't think she'd go for it, but apparently in international waters you can play single deck Black Jack.

speaker: Niles
text: � Um, actually Frasier, Daphne and I... would like to have you over at OUR house for Christmas this year.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Yeah, we just put up our tree and everything looks so lovely and it is our first Christmas as a married couple.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Well, uh, as lovely as that sounds--�

speaker: Niles
text: � [_interrupting_] Oh, come on, why not?!

speaker: Frasier
text: � Uh, well, Niles because it's a little late to be changing things, isn't it?� Besides, we've always had Christmas here, it's a tradition.  [_Martin is standing by the desk wearing glasses and holding an open dictionary._]

speaker: Martin
text: "Wassail - a Christmas punch."  [_Martin closes the dictionary and places it back on the desk._]�

speaker: Niles
text: � Frasier, you've had Christmas for the past nine years.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Yes, but we agreed that when you hosted Thanksgiving, that we would have Christmas here in its traditional setting.  [_Daphne starts to say something, but doesn't._]�

speaker: Niles
text: � Well maybe it's time to start a new tradition.

speaker: Frasier
text: � But I've had new stockings loomed for everyone - now there, you see, you've made me spoil the surprise - and did anyone hear that I have ordered a Hungarian goose?!  [_Martin sits back in his chair._]�

speaker: Niles
text: � Which you are more than welcome to bring to our place.

speaker: Frasier
text: � [_shouting_] It's not my date, it's dinner!  [_Niles looks irritated._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � [_continued_] Honestly Niles, I'm really quite affronted by this. [_Walks over to the dinner table and sits down in a chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � [_turns to Niles and whispers_] If it means that much to him, why don't we just let him keep it?�

speaker: Niles
text: � [_holding her wrist as she sits down on the couch and then lets go_] No, No! [_walks over to Martin's chair_] There is no reason why just this once we can't host Christmas at the Montana.� Frasier's just being a churl.

speaker: Frasier
text: � You're the churl!

speaker: Martin
text: � [_aggravated_] You're both a couple of churls.� How �bout a compromise? Say... morning at one house, afternoon at the other.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Well, that's a wonderful idea... but who gets morning and who gets afternoon?  [_Frasier jumps out of the chair that he is sitting in._]

speaker: Frasier & Niles
text: � [_both raise a hand_] Morning!

speaker: Daphne
text: � [_gets up from couch_] I think Niles said it first.  [_Niles turns to Frasier and goes "Ha!"� Frasier just gasps._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Dad, who do you think said it first?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sick of everything being a contest between the two of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Alright then dad, you decide where we're having Christmas.�

speaker: Niles
text: � I'm fine with that.  [_Daphne sits back down._]

speaker: Martin
text: Alright... I will.� I need a few days to think about it...  [_Niles quickly turns his head, like "great."_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_continues_] In the meantime, decision-making is thirsty work, sure could use a beer.�

speaker: Niles
text: � [_runs towards the kitchen_] Oh!� I'll get it!

speaker: Frasier
text: � [_runs after him_] NO!!�

speaker: Niles
text: � I got it!

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, will you shut up!  [_They both exit into the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns to Daphne_] A little trick their mom taught me.  [_We fade out_]  [_Commercial Break_]  [_Scene 3 - The mall.� We see Santa and a line of kids in front of him Roz is sitting down in front of him in her elf costume._]

speaker: Santa
text: � Don't worry Margie, you don't need a chimney.� Santa always finds a way in.� You have a Merry Christmas now. Margie:� Thank you Santa.

speaker: Santa
text: Ho, Ho, Ho.  [_Roz helps the little girl get down.� Frasier enters from the side with a bag._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Roz!� Hello.  [_Roz walks over to him._]���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh! Hi, Frasier, listen, when I'm at the North Pole my name is Snowflake.

speaker: Frasier
text: � It's a little on the nose, isn't it?  [_They both laugh._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Anyway, I was at the mall and thought that I'd drop off a donation for the Toy Drive.  [_He hands Roz a present from his bag._]

speaker: Roz
text: � Thank you very much.  [_She places the present with the others she turns back to Frasier and notices another gift in his bag._] ���

speaker: Roz
text: � Is this for us too?

speaker: Frasier
text: � No, no, actually this is another "Dancing Santa" for dad.� His other one got damaged.���

speaker: Roz
text: � I thought you threw that thing over the balcony?

speaker: Frasier
text: � Yes, which damaged it.  [_A girl dressed in an elf costume walks over to them._]��

speaker: Santa
text: � Ho, Ho, Ho.� Well Polly, what would you like Santa to bring you?

speaker: Girl Elf
text: � He wouldn't have to bring me anything, just show up.����

speaker: Roz
text: � Back off Twinkle, I saw him first.  [_Twinkle walks away._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � What's this?� Do I sense a little office romance... here at Santa's Workshop?���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh, I wouldn't mind.� His name is Rick and he's so... sweet.

speaker: Frasier
text: � And let me guess, he's also a hunk?���

speaker: Roz
text: � Well I wouldn't know, I haven't seen him without his Santa getup yet. But based on those eyes, [_looks at Rick, then turns back to Frasier_] there's definite potential.  [_Twinkle returns with gifts and places them with the others._]�

speaker: Santa
text: � Oh, Ho, Ho.� Santa needs his favorite helper elf.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh, see that, I'm his favorite. [_laughs_]

speaker: Twinkle
text: � Down Snowflake, I've got this one.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Okay Twinkle, you go ahead. [_then, gasps_] Oh, no, is that a zit?  [_As Roz rolls her eyes then leaves, Frasier drops his mouth open, while Twinkle puts her hand to her face and glances up at Frasier._]  [_We fade out_]  [_Scene 4 - Caf e Nervosa.� Frasier is sitting at the table next to the entrance.� Roz enters with her costume in a garment bag._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, Snowflake.� Over here.  [_Roz joins him._]���

speaker: Roz
text: � Hi.� I just got back from the costume shop, I had to get my toes� re-curled. [_Places her bag across her chair_]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Ah, which reminds me.� How are things with Mr. Claus, mm?���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh, I haven't had a chance to ask him out yet.

speaker: Frasier
text: � What's the matter?� Low... elf-esteem?���

speaker: Roz
text: � How long have you been waiting to say that?

speaker: Frasier
text: � Two days.� I almost called you. [_both laugh_]  [_Martin enters and Frasier notices Niles sitting over by the counter.� Martin goes over to Niles, who is dusting off his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � What's this?� Niles with dad.� I knew it!���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh!� You guys aren't still fighting about -- Christmas?

speaker: Frasier
text: � He's fighting.� I'm not fighting.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh, what is the big deal?� Why don't you let him have Christmas?

speaker: Frasier
text: � Because it is just so unfair.���

speaker: Roz
text: � What's not fair?

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, you wouldn't understand.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Well come on Frasier, talk to me.� Use your words.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Because, it's so egregious.���

speaker: Roz
text: � Smaller words.

speaker: Frasier
text: � I don't know.� Okay, look, it just seems that Niles is systematically emptying my home.� We used to have Thanksgiving dinner there... gone!� Daphne... gone!� If I let him have Christmas, I'll have nothing left.� Just end up some... doddering old bachelor sipping tea and keeping the apartment at a balmy seventy-eight degrees.���

speaker: Roz
text: � And how is that different from now?  [_Frasier gives her a look when he spies Niles giving Martin a thermos with a bow on top, from a bag that is on the table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Excuse me.� I smell skullduggery afoot.  [_He walks over to Martin and Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Hey, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: � Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: � New thermos?� Niles, I'd have never thought you'd stoop so low.�

speaker: Niles
text: � I have no idea at what you're talking about.� Just buying dad some coffee before driving him to work.

speaker: Frasier
text: � You are trying to bribe dad to have Christmas at your place!  [_Niles stands up._]

speaker: Niles
text: � Oh, and what about you?� Buying him the Dancing Santa.� A surprising gift, considering you threw his last one off the balcony!  [_Martin gasps and Frasier steps back._]

speaker: Martin
text: You did what?� That Santa never did anything to hurt you, all he ever did was dance and try to make people happy.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Yes, yes, alright dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Why'd you do it--

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, alright!�  [_N.B. Shouldn't Martin already know that Frasier threw his Dancing Santa off the balcony?  Remember in the tag credits of Season Seven, Episode Eleven[[7.11] "The Fight Before Christmas"](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_11/the_fight_before_christmas_2.html), Martin sees the hat on the balcony and looks down.  He then turns around to see Frasier so he know that HE did it!__]

speaker: Niles
text: � Why do you have to make everything so difficult?

speaker: Frasier
text: � Excuse me Niles, but I have news for you.� Copernicus called and you are not the center of the universe!

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, you two knock it off!�

speaker: Niles
text: � Let's just settle this now.� [_whispering and motioning to Frasier_] Sit down.� Dad, make your decision.  [_Frasier sits down._]

speaker: Martin
text: You know, I'm really disappointed in you guys.� I thought that if I gave you a little time, you'd be mature enough to work this out on your own.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Well you were wrong!

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, you know what?� I just made my decision.� I'm working Christmas.� Jimmy Daily asked me to take his shift and I'm gonna do it because he'll be happier with his family than I am with mine.  [_Martin grabs his hat and new thermos and they all stand up._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, dad, you can't be serious?

speaker: Martin
text: It's too late! [_people start to look, walks towards door_]� And you don't have to drive me to work, I can call a cab.� I hope you're happy! �You've ruined Christmas!  [_Roz gives an "uh-oh" look, the cafe falls silent for a few seconds before people start shouting insults.� Frasier turns back to Niles._]  Waiter:� [_at counter_] Not nice.  [_We fade out_]  [_End of Act I_]  [_Act II_]  [_Scene 1 - Martin's Office.� Niles and Frasier enter and Martin is at the desk._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Dad, uh, Niles and I would like to apologize.� It was untoward of us to... to argue of where to have Christmas.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Our conduct was... was self-absorbed and boorish.� Not that we deserve it, but please accept our apologies.

speaker: Martin
text: Apologies accepted.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Uh, thank you dad.� So you'll have Christmas with us?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm afraid I can't. I promised Jimmy that I'd work, and I can't go back on it.  [_An elevator "dings" and an officer comes out._] �

speaker: Frasier
text: � When do you start?

speaker: Martin
text: Six A.M., twelve-hour shift.� It's double time, so I'm not complaining.�

speaker: Niles
text: � No, that's the whole day.  [_Martin shrugs his shoulders at them as his supervisor comes over to them._]�  Supervisor:� Marty, I need you to let maintenance into the electrical closet on� seven.

speaker: Martin
text: Will do.� See you boys later.  [_Martin leaves as the officer takes his place._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Bye, dad.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Wow. [_sighs_] Christmas without dad.� This just won't be... Christmas.  [_As they talk the officer behind them eavesdrops on their conversation._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � I know.� He's always the first one under the tree.� Mom always said that he was the biggest kid, because he could never wait to open his presents.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Ha, ha.� [_sighs_] He always puts on a brave face, but I know he especially misses mom on Christmas.  [_Niles walks over to the door to leave, but Frasier stops him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Niles. Where is it written that we have to have Christmas at either of our homes?�

speaker: Niles
text: � The Thanksgiving Accord of 2002.

speaker: Frasier
text: � No, no.� What I am saying... is dad has to work.� Why can't we bring the holiday to him?�

speaker: Niles
text: � You mean just show up and surprise him?� I like that.� We can bring all our gifts and, and food.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, better yet.� What if the gifts were already here?�

speaker: Niles
text: � But...� [_looks confused_]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Okay, here's what I'm thinking.  [_They both walk over to the tree that is next to the door, looking down at the presents as they make their plan._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � We take the gifts that are here and put them under the tree at my house.� Get the real gifts and bring them here, all unbeknownst to dad.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Brilliant.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Can't you just see us casually stopping by on Christmas morning?� "Hello, dad.� Merry Christmas, oh it's just a shame that you had to spend Chri- Hello?� What's this I spy?� A present for Martin?"�

speaker: Niles
text: � [_imitating Martin_] "That's not for me, those are fake."

speaker: Frasier
text: � Well, here's another one.� One for Niles.� And one for Daphne.�

speaker: Niles
text: � Oh, geez it's a miracle.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Oh, Niles.� It'll be the best Christmas we've ever had!�

speaker: Niles
text: � [_looks at hand_] Look I'm getting goose bumps!

speaker: Frasier
text: � [_laughs then stops_] Oh no, Niles that's your pine rash, you're too close to the tree.  [_As they leave Niles scratches his ear._]  [_Scene 2 -� Cafe Nervosa.� Roz and Daphne are sitting at a table.� Rick is at the counter he turns around and notices Roz._]

speaker: Rick
text: � Hey!� Hi, Roz.  [_Roz doesn't recognize him._]�

speaker: Rick
text: � [_continued_] It, it's me, Rick.��

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh my God, Rick, I didn't even recognize you.�

speaker: Rick
text: � Ah, Roz and I volunteer down at the mall together.��

speaker: Roz
text: � Rick plays Santa.� Daphne, this is Rick - Rick, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Oh, Roz has told me all about you.� Would you like to join us?�

speaker: Rick
text: � I'd love to, but I have to get back to my day job.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Oh, what do you do?�

speaker: Rick
text: � I'm an investment banker.� Could you excuse me for just one second?  [_He goes back to counter._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � Wow, Roz!� You never told me he was so gorgeous.��

speaker: Roz
text: � Oh, I've never seen him out of his costume, before.

speaker: Daphne
text: � He's successful and he's got great taste.� Those shoes... Enrico Zangleones.  [_Roz looks surprised._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � [_continued_] Niles is teaching me.  [_Rick comes back with a to-go cup._]

speaker: Rick
text: � It's very nice meeting you, Daphne. [_she smiles and nods_] I'll see you tonight, Roz?� Maybe we could take our break together.� I stuck a bottle� of schnapps in my locker.

speaker: Roz
text: � [_doesn't seem excited_] Yeah, maybe.

speaker: Rick
text: � Is something wrong?� You don't like schnapps?

speaker: Roz
text: � No!� No, it's just so strange to see you without your beard.� You really should grow one.� It would make your eyes twinkle.

speaker: Rick
text: � Eh, I tried once.� Kinda came in... tough.� I looked like a dog on Rogaine.  [_They all laugh.� Rick's laugh is horrible._]��

speaker: Roz
text: � What was that?�

speaker: Rick
text: � I-I laughed.��

speaker: Roz
text: � That's your laugh?�

speaker: Rick
text: � Yeah.��

speaker: Roz
text: � Wow, at the mall it's so booming.�

speaker: Rick
text: � I--I know, I hate that.� It really kills my throat. [_turns to Daphne_] Very nice to meet you.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Bye, Bye.�

speaker: Rick
text: � [_turns to Roz_] I'll see you later.��

speaker: Roz
text: � Bye.  [_He leaves._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � Why are you being so weird?� He seems perfect. [_glances out the window_]��

speaker: Roz
text: � I'd don't know, just wasn't what I was expecting.� Something missing.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Like what?��

speaker: Roz
text: � I don't know.� Well, at the mall he has all this warmth and he's got this jolly sense of humor.� Oh, you should see him when he laughs, his whole stomach shakes.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Oh, my God.� You're in love with Santa Claus.� [_she giggles_]��

speaker: Roz
text: � [_leans in_] No, I'm not.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Well, it makes sense when you think about it.� Santa's the perfect man.� He's a good listener, he likes to travel, he gives great presents. [_giggles again_]��

speaker: Roz
text: � Give me a break.

speaker: Daphne
text: � Admit it.� You want the jelly belly. [_giggles_]��

speaker: Roz
text: � Okay, don't be gross.  [_She grabs her purse from the floor and sets it on the table._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � You want to bang-boots with the big boy.  [_She laughs as Roz gets up from her chair and grabs her coat from it._]��

speaker: Roz
text: � [_puts her coat on_] I have to get to work.

speaker: Daphne
text: � [_gets up from chair_] You want to get your paws on the Claus is more like it.��  [_Daphne grabs her coat and purse_]

speaker: Roz
text: �  Stop it, Daphne! That's enough! [_she exits_]

speaker: Daphne
text: � [_walks after her_] One more: you're a Ho, Ho, Ho.  [_We fade out_]  [_Scene 3 - Frasier's apartment.� Eddie is on the floor next to Martin's chair drinking eggnog out of a punch bowl. He is wearing a plaid outfit.� The camera pans up and we see Martin sitting in his chair drinking out of a punch glass.� He finishes and sighs.� Frasier enters from his room._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Dad! [_grabs coat from hook_] What are you doing still sitting there? [_walks over behind the couch_] I told you ten minutes ago that we were� going out for Christmas Eve ice cream.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I changed my mind. Eddie and I are too bloated from the nog.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Well, then maybe we should, uh, take Eddie and uh, walk it off. � Come on, mister!� Let's go!  [_He walks over to the door and grabs his keys._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets his cane and walks to the kitchen_] No, I'm gonna be up early for work.� I sure could use somethin' to nibble on, though.  [_We see the front door starting to open slowly.� Niles and Daphne are in the hallway with an armload of presents they are trying to get in._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � No, no, no, no. [_pushes them back into the hall_]�

speaker: Niles
text: � Stop pushing.� Stop pushing.  [_Frasier shuts the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: � Listen.� Dad's still here, I couldn't get rid of him.� You'll have to come back in an hour.�

speaker: Niles
text: � N--N-- No.� We can't do that.� The maintenance man in dad's building was so nervous about us taking these out of the lobby, I promised him we'd have our real gifts under his tree by ten o'clock.

speaker: Frasier
text: � Alright, what we need is a really good distraction. [_thinks for a moment_] I'll tell you what.� Knock when you think of one.  [_He goes back into the apartment and shuts the door.� Martin comes back into the kitchen with a bowl._]

text: What were you doing out there?

text: � Nothing.� Thought I heard the door knock.  [_The second he finishes saying this, the door knocks.� Frasier jumps._]

text: Hey, that's pretty good.  [_Frasier opens the door and Niles and Daphne come in, with no gifts._]

text: � Oh, hello guys.� Dad, look who it is.� It's Niles and Daphne.

text: I see 'em.

text: � Good question, Frasier.� Daphne?

text: � I need your father's help with a present, and that's what we're doing here.�

text: �Exactly, yes.

text: � [_goes over to tree and picks up a present_] Come on Martin, we can do this in my old room.

text: No, problem.  [_He follows her._]

text: � Okay, now!� [_he goes over to grab some presents_]� Real presents go out in the hall by the door, fake presents under the tree.  [_Niles takes the presents into the hallway._]

text: Niles, did you notice my Christmas village?� Would you like to see smoke waft out of the cobbler's chimney?

speaker: Niles
text: � [_places gifts next to the elevator_] Uh, maybe later. [_grabs presents from the pile next to the apartment door and brings them in_] Frasier, I have to warn you.� These prop boxes are heavy - some idiot weighed them down with bricks.  [_He passes Frasier who has a pile of presents._]

text: [_takes his presents into the hall_] Just with our luck, we get the only lobby decorator in all of Seattle.  [_He places his presents next to the apt. door and grabs the ones that Niles had just placed next to the elevator.� He brings those into the apartment and passes Niles._]�

speaker: Frasier
text: How much time do you think Daphne can buy over dad?

speaker: Niles
text: � Not much. [_stops at door_] They're just putting batteries in the digital camera that we're giving you. [_gives an "oops" look, then he does his famous grin_]� Act surprised. [_goes into the hall_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right! [_places his presents by the tree_]  [_Daphne yells as she comes into living room with Martin following._]

speaker: Daphne
text: � I said I'd get them!!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you'll never find them.� How could you ask me to put batteries in ����������when you didn't bring any batteries? [_Niles enters with an armload of ����������presents as he sees Martin_]� Now, boys, you know the rules.� No shaking ����������the presents.

text: You see Niles, I told you.  [_Niles pretends to shake the gifts.� Daphne comes out of the kitchen._]

text: � I found them.� Let's go.� [_Martin and her head back, but Frasier�stops her._]

text: [_whispering_] Daphne!� No more surprises.

text: � Oh, you mean like finding your father here, when the apartment's ����������supposed to be empty?! [_goes back to the bedroom_]

text: Well, you can blame that on the nog!!  [_Niles places presents under�the tree as he picks up a new pile._]

speaker: Niles
text: � [_places them in the hall near the elevator_] Frasier, [_grunts and picks up a pile next to the apt. door_] I think I'm going to sleep tonight, ����������I feel like I'm ten years old. text: Yes.� Only this time we have the merry chance of playing Santa.  [_Frasier laughs as he puts his presents with the ones next to the elevator and picks up a new pile that is next to the apt. door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I'm so sorry that we almost ruined Christmas with our arguing.�  [_Niles passes Frasier with a pile of presents.� He then looks at the presents that Frasier has and stops walking._]

text: � Stop!�

text: What?

text: � I just took that from under the tree.

text: � Yes, I did.� I know, �cause that's real and fake ones are in a pile ����������by the door.

text: The elevator door?

text: Great.� Now what do we do?

text: � Well here, alright, you take these.

text: Yes.

text: � I take those.  [_They mumble words as they go in the wrong directions._]

text: What are we...

text: � Where do we go?

text: That's a flat head and I need a Phillips head. [_Daphne follows._]

text: � [_he motions Frasier to place the presents under the tree_] See, I told ����������you, if you rearrange them they look fuller. [_Makes it look like he was arranging them_]

text: Yes, yes, I see what you mean, Niles.� It's all a matter of perspective.

text: Wow, it looks like twice as many.� Uh, put them back the way they were ����������and show me how you did that. [_he motions with his finger_]

text: � [_comes out of the kitchen_] Got the Philips.� Let's go.�  [_She motions for them to "move it along" while Martin heads back to the bedroom._]

speaker: Niles
text: � He could be an assassin in those slippers.

text: � Are you two going to switch the presents?� Or are you going to argue ����������about whose Christmas village is bigger? [_she heads to the bedroom_]

text: [_gasps as Niles picks up a pile of "real" presents from under the tree_] ����������I knew it!� You didn't compliment mine, because you have one too.

text: � [_turns around with presents in hand_] I didn't compliment yours, because ����������yours is so poorly laid out!!

text: Alright, alright.� We don't have time for this, now which ones are which?

text: � Oh, oh!� I have them all organized.� Here, take those out. [_hands Frasier the pile of gifts and gets some for himself to take out_]

text: Are you sure?

text: � Yes, absolutely.� These-these are the real ones.� These go to dad, ����������out in the hall and we'll take them together.� [_both go to the hall_]

text: Fine. alright, alright.� [_starts to mumble_]

text: � Fine, then here. [_sets gifts down in the hall_] Now we're all set.� ����������[_takes gifts from Frasier_] All the fake ones are under the tree.

text: Yes, now you put those in the elevator.� I'll tell Daphne the coast ����������is clear.  [_Frasier shuts the door.� Daphne comes out of the bedroom with Martin following, sounding sorrowful._]

text: � Do you have any idea how much I paid for that?

text: Oh, stop cryin'.� Just put a little duct tape on it and it'll be good ����������as new.

text: � [_shouting_] It was new! [_goes to kitchen_]

text: [_runs to kitchen_] Here Daphne, I'll help you find the tape.  [_Eddie is at the front door barking.� Martin walks over to the coat rack._]

text: What's the matter, boy?� Too much eggnog, huh? [_laughs_] Okay. [_yells to kitchen_] Hey, Daph. text: Wait, dad!� I'll do that.� You should just relax.

text: No, that's alright.� I need the fresh air. [_opens door, we see Niles_]� ����������Uh-oh.� What's this, more presents?� Is this why you were trying to ����������keep me busy back there?

text: � [_not sure of what to do_] Yes.

text: [_laughs_]�� Oh, ohh, why, you didn't need to do that.� Bring 'em on in.� ����������Frasier, give your brother a hand.�  [_Frasier goes into hall as Niles comes in with a pile of presents.� They give each other looks._]

text: [_Frasier comes in with a pile_] Mix them all up, so they'll look fuller. text: [_has coat in hand_] Right. [_walks to door_]

text: � [_laughs_] This is so exciting,� I can't wait to see the look on your ����������Father's face when we go over there and surprise him.  [_As they head out the door Martin comes out from the hall dressed in matching pj's and robe._]

text: Merry Christmas!  [_Daphne, Niles and Frasier quickly turn towards him in shock._]

text: Dad, uh, what are you doing here?

text: � [_looks at his watch_] Yes, aren't you supposed to be at work? [_laughs slightly_]

text: [_walks down the steps_] Oh, the boss called, I don't have to go in.� ����������Seems he was feeling guilty about me missing Christmas with my family.� ����������[_picks up a present_]� Ooh, heavy.� This must be a good one, [_walks over to his chair and sits down_] unless it's a book.

text: � But, who's covering the desk?

text: Nobody, she's shut down tight 'til tomorrow.� Now, I have just enough ����������patience to wait for the cocoa before I start tearing into these.  [_The others look horribly sad._]

text: [_sad_] Don't tell me there's no cocoa.  [_Niles, Daphne and Frasier look at each other._]  [_Scene 4 - Martin's Office.� Daphne, Niles, Martin and Frasier are standing at the entrance.� Daphne is knocking at the glass doors._]

text: � [_Frasier taps on the door, too_] Hello?� Hello?
